description: Odd primes p with one zero in Fibonacci numbers mod p.
comments: Also, odd primes that divide Lucas numbers of odd index. - _T. D. Noe_, Jul 25 2003
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
C. Ballot and M. Elia, Rank and period of primes in the Fibonacci sequence; a trichotomy, Fib. Quart., 45 (No. 1, 2007), 56-63 (The sequence B1).
formula: A prime p = prime(i) is in this sequence if p > 2 and A001602(i)/2 is odd. - _T. D. Noe_, Jul 25 2003
crossrefs: Cf. A001176. See A112860 for another version.
Cf. A000204 (Lucas numbers), A001602 (index of the smallest Fibonacci number divisible by prime(n)), A053029 (primes dividing no Lucas number), A053027 (primes dividing Lucas numbers of even index).
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Feb 23 2000
